page.title: 13JUNIOR CLUBS IN CORBRIDGE
page.content: Several of the clubs for children in the village are part of the world wide organisation of Guiding and Scouting.Brownies for girls aged seven to ten years,Girl Guides for ten to fourteen year olds,Cubs for boys aged eight to ten and Boy Scouts for eleven to sixteen year olds.They meet weekly for one and a half hours and play group games and work for interest badges such as first aid,cookery and animal lover.Junior Red Cross is for boys and girls between the ages of six and twelve.The weekly meetings are for one hour and are spent learning some of the basics of first aid and playing group games.The Youth Clubs cater for eleven to eighteen year olds on three evenings a week and they can play darts,table tennis and dance to records.
